clean_content:
Definition / general

* Rare, benign splenic lesion of unknown etiology, characterized by confluent angiomatoid nodules surrounded by concentric collagen fibers

Essential features

* Nonneoplastic condition that affects the spleen only; not described in other sites* Microscopically characterized by multiple angiomatoid nodules in a fibrosclerotic stroma* Surgery is curative in all the cases and recurrence has not been reported

Terminology

* Multinodular hemangioma (obsolete)

ICD coding

* ICD-10: [D18.03](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/D10-D36/D18-/D18.03) - hemangioma of intra-abdominal structures

Epidemiology

* Female predilection (F:M = 2:1)* Mean age of 48 years* Range is 30 - 60 years ([Int J Surg Case Rep 2012;3:492](22858789))

Sites

* Only described in the spleen* Confined to the splenic parenchyma, with no extrasplenic involvement

Etiology

* Etiology and pathogenesis unknown* Exaggerated sclerotic and neoangiogenic splenic reaction could be secondary to different pre-existing conditions, including vascular lesions undergoing thrombosis, infarcts and even hamartoma ([Int J Surg Case Rep 2012;3:492](22858789), [Am J Surg Pathol 2004;28:1268](15371942))

Clinical features

* Asymptomatic in the majority of the cases; incidentally discovered by imaging studies or at time of surgery for unrelated processes ([Am J Surg Pathol 2004;28:1268](15371942))* Symptomatic patients may experience nonspecific symptoms, including abdominal discomfort, abdominal fullness, nausea, vomiting and undesired weight loss

Diagnosis

* Clinically and radiologically indistinguishable from other lesions of the spleen, including hemangioma, hamartoma and rarely, malignancies* Final diagnosis is achieved only with histopathologic examination and immunohistochemistry of resected spleen specimens* Splenectomy serves both diagnostic and treatment functions* References: [Am J Surg Pathol 2004;28:1268](15371942), [Semin Diagn Pathol 2021;38:159](32600744)

Laboratory

* Laboratory values are mostly unaltered* Occasional reports of nonspecific findings, including raised erythrocyte sedimentation rate, leukocytosis and polyclonal hypergammaglobulinemia ([Am J Surg Pathol 2004;28:1268](15371942))

Radiology description

* No characteristic and unique radiologic findings of this entity* Abdominal ultrasound, CT scan and MRI studies usually reveal an isolated, multinodular solid splenic mass* References: [J Comput Assist Tomogr 2019;43:863](31688246), [Diagn Interv Imaging 2021;102:389](33495124)

Radiology images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoidradio1.jpeg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3516950/figure/F0001/)

CT findings

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoidradio2.jpeg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3205371/figure/F1/)

Expansible low density mass

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoid_ij01.gif)](https://www.ijcasereportsandimages.com/archive/2012/006-2012-ijcri/008-06-2012-shinjo/ijcri-00806201288-shinjo.pdf#page=2)

5 cm tumor in hilus

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoid_ij02.gif)](https://www.ijcasereportsandimages.com/archive/2012/006-2012-ijcri/008-06-2012-shinjo/ijcri-00806201288-shinjo.pdf#page=2)

Hypointensity of tumor

  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoidthumbimg03.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3421142/figure/fig0005/)

Splenic lesion at medial aspect

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoidthumbimg04.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3421142/figure/fig0010/)

Lesion in lower spleen

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoidthumbimg05.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3019590/figure/F1/)

Hypoenhancing mass

Prognostic factors

* Benign clinical behavior with favorable prognosis and no reported recurrences after splenectomy ([Am J Surg Pathol 2004;28:1268](15371942))

Case reports

* 21 year old woman with mild thrombocytopenia and a hypervascular splenic mass ([Radiol Case Rep 2018;14:521](30906490))* 26 year old man and 65 year old woman presenting with undesired weight loss and a lasting feeling of abdominal fullness ([World J Clin Cases 2020;8:103](31970175))* 37 year old woman with a 5 cm hypoechoic mass in the spleen with low standardized uptake value (SUV) at FDG PET / CT scan ([Acta Radiol Open 2016;5:2058460116649799](27570634))* 49 year old woman with a newly diagnosed invasive clear cell carcinoma of the uterus and a 4 cm isolated splenic nodule suspicious for metastatic involvement ([J Med Case Rep 2018;12:377](30579362))* 67 year old man with an isolated 55 mm splenic lesion suspicious for an abscess ([Int J Surg Case Rep 2019;56:1](30798093))

Treatment

* Splenectomy performed at discovery of the splenic mass is curative in all the cases

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoidclinical1.jpeg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3516950/figure/F0002/)

Macroscopic findings

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoidclinical2.jpeg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3205371/figure/F2/)

Laparoscopic view

Gross description

* Single unencapsulated, well circumscribed solid mass with a striking multinodular quality and variable fibrotic strands ([Semin Diagn Pathol 2021;38:159](32600744))

Gross images

Contributed by Shafinaz Hussein, M.D. and Huifei Liu, M.D., Ph.D. ([Case #364](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364.htm))  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image1.jpg)

Circumscribed, bosselated, firm, tan colored mass

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoidthumbimg08.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3205371/figure/F3/)

Well demarcated, unencapsulated lesion

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoidthumbimg09.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3019590/figure/F2/)

Splenic resection

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoid_ijpm03.jpg)](https://www.ijpmonline.org/viewimage.asp?img=IndianJPatholMicrobiol_2011_54_4_829_91543_u1.jpg)

Well defined, nonencapsulated lesion

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/spleensclerosingangiomatoid_ij04.gif)](http://www.ijcasereportsandimages.com/archive/2012/006-2012-ijcri/008-06-2012-shinjo/ijcri-00806201288-shinjo-full-text.php)

Red-brown, multinodular lesions

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Multiple, well circumscribed and confluent angiomatoid nodules surrounded by a variable fibrosclerotic stroma and occasionally, by a fibrinoid rim imparting a granuloma-like appearance at low magnification ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2007;131:974](17550330), [Semin Diagn Pathol 2021;38:159](32600744))* Nodules contain a mixture of slit-like, round or irregular vascular spaces lined by cytologically bland, sometimes plump endothelial cells; lacking atypia, necrosis and mitotic figures* 3 different types of vessels within the nodules can be highlighted by immunohistochemistry (see [Positive stains](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/spleensclerosingangiomatoid.html#positivestains)), which recapitulate the normal red pulp composition: capillaries, sinusoids and small veins* Stroma separating the nodules is fibrous to fibromyxoid with bland fibroblasts and myofibroblasts; contains abundant inflammatory cells, including lymphocytes, hemosiderin laden macrophages and polytypic plasma cells ([Semin Diagn Pathol 2021;38:159](32600744))* IgG4 positive plasma cells occasionally numerous with IgG4:IgG ratio increased; however, serum IgG4 concentration not elevated ([Pathol Int 2009;59:844](20021608))* Adjacent splenic tissue is unremarkable

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Valentina Sangiorgio, M.D., Shafinaz Hussein, M.D. and Huifei Liu, M.D., Ph.D. ([Case #364](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364.htm))  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/spleensclerosingangiomatoidSangiorgio01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/spleensclerosingangiomatoidSangiorgio01.jpg)

Multiple vascular nodules

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/spleensclerosingangiomatoidSangiorgio02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/spleensclerosingangiomatoidSangiorgio02.jpg)

Predominantly small capillaries

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image6_40xnew.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image6_40xnew.jpg)

Bland endothelial cells

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image7CD8_10xnew.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image7CD8_10xnew.jpg)

CD8

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image8CD31_10xnew.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image8CD31_10xnew.jpg)

CD31

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image9CD34_10xnew.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case364image9CD34_10xnew.jpg)

CD34

Positive stains

* 3 types of vessels (as seen in the normal splenic red pulp):
  + Capillaries: [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html)+ / [CD8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd8.html)- / [CD31](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd31.html)++ Sinusoids: [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html)- / [CD8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd8.html)+ / [CD31](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd31.html)++ Small veins: [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html)- / [CD8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd8.html)- / [CD31](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd31.html)+* [SMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalphasmoothmuscleactin.html) positive in myofibroblasts in the nodules* [CD68](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd68.html) positive in histiocytes / macrophages* Polytypic expression of [kappa](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainskappa.html) and [lambda](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainskappa.html) light chains within plasma cells* References: [Am J Surg Pathol 2004;28:1268](15371942), [Arch Pathol Lab Med 2013;137:1309](23991745)

Negative stains

* [D2-40](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsD240.html)* [Epstein Barr virus (EBV)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainseber1.html) in situ hybridization

Electron microscopy description

* Small vascular spaces lined by endothelial cells with pinocytotic vesicles but no Weibel-Palade bodies ([Am J Surg Pathol 2004;28:1268](15371942))

Sample pathology report

* Spleen, splenectomy:
  + Sclerosing angiomatoid nodular transformation (SANT) of the spleen

Differential diagnosis

* [Hemangioma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/spleenhemangioma.html):
  + Often of cavernous type+ Cystically dilated, blood filled spaces lined by a layer of bland endothelial cells+ Vascular spaces separated by thin fibrous septa, without the striking angiomatoid nodular appearance of sclerosing angiomatoid nodular transformation ([Semin Diagn Pathol 2021;38:154](32674844))* [Littoral cell angioma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/spleenlittoralcellangioma.html):
    + Macroscopically enlarged spleen overrun by multiple hemorrhagic nodules with a vague lobular configuration and a spongy appearance; uncommonly solitary nodules+ Nodules composed of pleomorphic vascular spaces filled with papillary projections+ Papillary stalks lined by plump endothelial cells+ Characteristic immunophenotype of splenic littoral cells with dual histiocytic and endothelial differentiation lacking [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html)* [Hemangioendothelioma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissuehemangioendotheliomaepithelioid.html) and [angiosarcoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissueangiosarcoma.html):
      + Ill defined vascular spaces lined by variably atypical, malignant endothelial cells, with necrosis and increased mitotic activity ([Semin Diagn Pathol 2021;38:154](32674844))* [Hamartoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/spleenhamartoma.html):
        + Structurally disorganized red pulp tissue, with no Malpighian follicles and only occasional fibrous trabeculae+ Compared with sclerosing angiomatoid nodular transformation, the borders are poorly defined and it lacks the angiomatoid nodular appearance ([Semin Diagn Pathol 2021;38:154](32674844))
